metadata.title: CVE-2017-7537 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: It was found that a mock CMC authentication plugin with a hardcoded secretwas accidentally enabled by default in the pki-core package before 10.6.4.An attacker could potentially use this flaw to bypass the regularauthentication process and trick the CA server into issuing certificates.

criterions.comment: dogtag-pki: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
